body:
Bumped versions for 1.33.1

Please ensure:
- [x] Target branch is correct (`vX.XX` if a patch release, `main` if minor)
- [x] Crate versions are bumped correctly
- [x] deno_std version is incremented in the code (see `cli/deno_std.rs`)
- [x] Releases.md is updated correctly (think relevancy and remove reverts)

To make edits to this PR:
```shell
git fetch upstream release_1_33.1 && git checkout -b release_1_33.1 upstream/release_1_33.1
```

cc @bartlomieju

title: fix(ext/websocket): restore op_ws_send_ping
body:
This op doesn't exist anymore and is pings are handled automatically by
the Rust crate.

title: fix(ext/fetch): subview Uint8Array in Req/Resp
body: Fixes #18857

title: fix(repl): don't panic on undefined exception
body:
Fixes regression from #18878 where `Promise.reject()`, `Promise.reject(undefined)` and `reportError(undefined)` panic in the REPL.
Fixes `throw undefined` printing `Uncaught Unknown exception` instead of `Uncaught undefined`.

title: build: define features for 'hyper' crate
body:
Fixes the "publish" CI step. Somehow neither `cargo build` nor
`cargo clippy` don't complain about it.

title: Revert "refactor: don't expose Deno[Deno.internal].core namespace"
body: Also conditionally disabled one test if there's not enough space on device.

- [x] deno_std version is incremented in the code (see `cli/deno_std.rs`)
- [x] Releases.md is updated correctly (think relevancy and remove reverts)

To make edits to this PR:
```shell
git fetch upstream release_1_33.0 && git checkout -b release_1_33.0 upstream/release_1_33.0
```

title: fix(repl): print unhandled rejections and event errors
body:
Fixes #8858.
Fixes #8869.

```
$ target/debug/deno
Deno 1.32.5
exit using ctrl+d, ctrl+c, or close()
REPL is running with all permissions allowed.
To specify permissions, run `deno repl` with allow flags.
> Promise.reject(new Error("bar"));
Promise { <rejected> Error: bar
    at <anonymous>:2:16 }
Uncaught (in promise) Error: bar
    at <anonymous>:2:16
> reportError(new Error("baz"));
undefined
Uncaught Error: baz
    at <anonymous>:2:13
>

title: feat(kv): return ok bool from atomic commit
body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
7. Open as a draft PR if your work is still in progress. The CI won't run
   all steps, but you can add '[ci]' to a commit message to force it to.
8. If you would like to run the benchmarks on the CI, add the 'ci-bench' label.
-->

title: feat(lint): add `Deno.run` to `no-deprecated-deno-api`
body: This upgrade includes warning for deprecated "Deno.run()" API.

title: chore: upgrade rusty_v8 to 0.71.0
body: Upgrade V8 to v11.4

title: refactor(cli): extract out ProcState from CliMainWorker
body: More extracting of ProcState. I'm looking to re-use the `CliMainWorker` with deno compile.

title: feat: Deprecate Deno.run API in favor of Deno.Command (#17630)
body:
This commit adds `@deprecated` comments to `Deno.run` API declarations.
Since stabilization of `Deno.Command` API in [Deno v1.31](https://deno.com/blog/v1.31#api-stabilizations), `Deno.Command` is the preferred (more reliable) API to interact with subprocesses.
This is the preparation for the removal of `Deno.run` API in Deno 2.0.

title: refactor(ext/node): migrate back to using "Deno.serve" API for HTTP server
body:
This commit fixes "node:http" API to properly handle "upgrade"
requests and thus marking Vite work again.

This is done by migrating back to "Deno.serve()" and internal "upgradeHttpRaw"
APIs for "node:http" module polyfill.

labels.name: ci-bench
labels.description: put this on a PR to run the benchmarks

title: perf(ext/websocket): various performance improvements
body:
- No need to wrap buffer in a `new DataView()`
- Deferred ops are still eagerly polled, but resolved on the next
tick of the event loop, we don't want them to be eagerly polled
- Using "core.opAsync"/"core.opAsync2" incurs additional cost
of looking up these functions on each call. Similarly with "ops.*"

title: refactor(ext/node): use a snapshottable global name for Node's globalThis
body: We want to initialize the node runtime in the snapshot and remove the conditional error-prone initialization logic.

title: fix(ext/node): prime generation
body:
Towards https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/18455

`safe`, `add` and `rem` options are not implemented because there is no rust crate that provides this functionality (except rust-openssl maybe) and its just not clear if this API is used widely.

title: fix(ext/http): internal upgradeHttpRaw works with "Deno.serve()" API

labels.name: ci-bench
labels.description: put this on a PR to run the benchmarks

body:
Fix internal "upgradeHttpRaw" API restoring capability to upgrade HTTP
connection in polyfilles "node:http" API.

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.

title: fix(test): handle dispatched exceptions from test functions
body: Fixes #18852.

title: perf(ext/http): avoid spread arg deopt in op_http_wait

hello world on macOS:

title: feat(node/crypto): Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) support
body:
WIP.

- getCurves() supported
- computeSecret() for establishing a shared secret between two parties
- generateKeys() for generating a keypair

Curves:
- [x] secp256k1
- [x] prime256v1 / secp256r1
- [x] k256 et al
- [x] p384 et al

TODO:
- [x] Support all above curves
- [x] `encoding` parameter in ECDH class
- [ ] `formatting` parameter in ECDH class
- [ ] ECDH::convertKeys support
- [ ] Clean up mutable references in ops

My gist for testing some of this:
https://gist.github.com/levex/6a22f20eea40e0eb337a02ba906f79d8
(will be updated as the PR progresses)

title: refactor(ext/node): enforce interior mutable for `NodePermissions` to remove clones
body: We can make `NodePermissions` rely on interior mutability (which the `PermissionsContainer` is already doing) in order to not have to clone everything all the time. This also reduces the chance of an accidental `borrow` while `borrrow_mut`.

title: refactor(ext/node): allow injecting `NodeFs` from CLI
body: This allows providing a `NodeFs` as part of the `WorkerOptions`.

title: docs: add categories to APIs without
body: I wonder if we should have a lint rule for this

title: fix(npm): only include top level packages in top level node_modules directory
body:
We were indeterministically including packages in the top level `node_modules/` folder when using a local node_modules directory. This change aligns with pnpm and only includes top level packages in this folder. This should be faster for initializing the folder, but may expose issues in packages that reference other packages not defined in their dependencies. That said, the behaviour previously was previously broken.

This has exposed a bug in the require implementation where it doesn't find a package (which is the main underlying issue here). There is a failing test already for this in the test suite after this change.

Closes #18822

title: test: disable flaky Node test
body: If we hit a slow runner this test almost always fails.

title: refactor(ext/websocket): use specialized ops
body:
Instead of relying on `op_ws_send` to send different kinds of messages,
use specialized ops everywhere.

title: fix(ext/node): fix hash.flush
body: closes #18785

title: feat(ext/http): h2c for http/2
body: This implements HTTP/2 prior-knowledge connections, allowing clients to request HTTP/2 over plaintext or TLS-without-ALPN connections. If a client requests a specific protocol via ALPN (`h2` or `http/1.1`), however, the protocol is forced and must be used.

title: feat(serde_v8): better error output
body: The type that was received is now printed as part of a message.

fix(ext/http): ensure that multiple upgrades and multiple simultaneous requests cannot cause a panic
body: Fix a bug where we weren't saving `slabId` in #18619, plus add some robustness checks around multiple upgrades (w/test).

place where we rely on `tokio_tungstenite` now.

Move all op related code of "ext/node" to "ext/node/ops" module.

These files were unnecessarily scattered around the extension.

title: refactor(node): move most of cli/node to ext/node
body: This is just a straight refactor and I didn't do any cleanup in ext/node. After this PR we can start to clean it up and make things private that don't need to be public anymore.

title: refactor(core): remove ops from Deno.core.ops that are disabled

This commit changes how "disabled" ops behave. Instead of using "void"
functions under the hood, they now explicitly throw errors saying
that a given op doesn't exist.

body: Fixes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/18775

- implement setTimeout with matching semantics of Node
- add the test from Node but leave it turned off because ClientRequest has no underlying socket

title: fix(compile): write bytes directly to output file
body:
1. Adds cli/standalone folder
2. Writes the bytes directly to the output file. When adding npm packages this might get quite large, so let's not keep the final output in memory just in case.

title: refactor(core): return better error for non-existent async ops
fix(ext/node): improve vm.runInThisContext
body:
This PR improves the compatibility of `vm.runInThisContext`

closes #17853

title: refactor(ext/node): remove polyfills/_core.ts
body: This change removes `ext/node/polyfills/_core.ts`. This was necessary in `std/node`, but now should be unnecessary.

title: fix(ext/node): add crypto.sign|verify methods
body:
This PR adds `crypto.sign` and `crypto.verify` methods. (These are shorthands of `createSign().update().sign()` or `createVerify().update().verify()`)

This PR also changes the Sign and Verify class callable with/without `new` operator. (This behavior will be necessary when we enable `test/parallel/test-crypto-sign-verify.js`)

part of #18455

title: tests: deflake 'check_sockopt'
body:
This function was inherently racy which showed on slow machines -
the connect future started before the spawned task was first polled.

This change makes it so we're already accepting a connection when
the connect future is first polled.

title: chore: disable flaky Node compat tests
body:
I'm not able to reproduce any of the failures from CI on my machine.

I'm going to disable these tests for now as they are holding us back.

title: BREAKING(unstable): remove "Deno.serve(handler, options)" overload
body: In preparation to stabilization of the API this overload was decided to be removed.

title: docs: Improve inline docs for permissions (deno run --help)
body:
Hey there! I took a crack at improving these embedded docs [as requested here](https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/18685). These should accurately reflect the functionality of the permission-related flags for `deno run`.

### Highlights
* Adds human-readable argument string in the format [prescribed in the docs](https://docs.rs/clap/latest/clap/struct.Arg.html#method.value_name)
* Keeps text description terse, but includes a relevant copy/pasteable docs link
* Includes example argument usage/formatting

### Formatting preview
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29193/232874562-93d63472-2fd7-4291-8c1e-f0eac351608f.png)

### Testing locally
* [Configure local environment](https://deno.land/manual@v1.32.4/references/contributing/building_from_source)
* Build CLI with `cargo build -vv`
* Run `./target/debug/deno run --help`

title: fix(core): Wrap safe collections' argument of primordials
body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
7. Open as a draft PR if your work is still in progress. The CI won't run
   all steps, but you can add '[ci]' to a commit message to force it to.
8. If you would like to run the benchmarks on the CI, add the 'ci-bench' label.
-->

Collections such as `Set` cause prototype pollution by [treating argument as a iterable](https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-set-iterable).

```js
// prototype pollution
const original = Array.prototype[Symbol.iterator];
Array.prototype[Symbol.iterator] = function (...args) { console.log("bang!"); return original.apply(this, args); }

// current primordials
new SafeSet([1, 2, 3]); // bang!
```

This PR fix that situation. It affects performance, but the scope should be quite limited.

title: refactor(core): store v8::Global<v8::Context> in an Rc
body:
Alternative to https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/18726.

This was suggested by @piscisaureus. It's a bit ugly, but it does the work
and makes cloning `JsRealm` very cheap, while not requiring invasive changes.

Also managed to remove some vector and `v8::Global` clones which yields
about 5% improvement in the "async_ops_deferred.js" benchmark.

This PR:
```
time 1689 ms rate 592066
time 1722 ms rate 580720
time 1629 ms rate 613873
time 1578 ms rate 633713
time 1585 ms rate 630914
time 1574 ms rate 635324
```

`main` branch:
```
time 1687 ms rate 592768
time 1676 ms rate 596658
time 1651 ms rate 605693
time 1652 ms rate 605326
time 1638 ms rate 610500
```

CC @andreubotella

title: fix(ext/node): polyfill response._implicitHeader method
body:
This PR polyfills `ServerResponse.prototype._implicitHeader` private API of Node.js, which is used by `npm:compression` (ref: [source](https://github.com/expressjs/compression/blob/ad5113b98cafe1382a0ece30bb4673707ac59ce7/index.js#L84)), which is a dependency of `npm:json-server`.

closes #18325

title: chore: update node compat config
body: This PR updates node compat configs. Currently if you execute `tools/node_compat/setup.ts`, these diffs appear. (Maybe this should have been checked in CI...)

title: fix(ext/node): add req.socket.remoteAddress
body:
This PR adds mock `socket` property to (incoming) http request object (for server). `req.socket.remoteAddress` is used by `npm:forwarded` (which is a dependency of `npm:json-server`).

related: https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/18325

title: chore(ext/fs): decouple fs trait from deno_core
body:
This commit removes the dependencies on `deno_core` for the Fs trait.
This allows to move the trait into a different crate that does not
depend on core in the limit.

This adds a new `bounds` field to `deno_core::extension!` that expands to
`where` clauses on the generated code. This allows to add bounds to the
extension parameters, such as `Fs::File: Resource`.

title: Revert "perf(core): immediately schedule another tick if there are un…
body:
…polled ops (#18611)"

This reverts commit 4317055a3e49c7a75648480bbc86e4b466c60b5e.

Reverting because we discovered while working on https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/18619 that it doesn't work correctly (sometimes waker just stops working).

Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/18710

title: feat(cli): don't check permissions for statically analyzable dynamic imports
body:
Closes #17697. Hoping to get this in a minor release, see https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/17697#issuecomment-1486208485.
Closes #17658.

title: chore: fix running node tests in parallel on Windows
refactor: add `TypeChecker` struct
body: Adds a `TypeChecker` struct and pushes more shared functionality into it.
